resources.string: Description of JAR and some useful information
Long Term Saving for Spending Account
This Jar is for EDUcational stuff, like payments for colledge or tutor, educational books, movies and trainings etc.
This Jar is a guaranty of your financial wellness. Cash from this jar must be untouchable in any case, just for investments or passive gain.
Cash from this Jar is for charity or gifts.
This account is used for big purchase (like a car, vacation on Bali, new teeth…) or may be a buffer for your financial safety.
Cash in this Jar is for NECessities - food, rent, transport, medicine, clothing etc.
This Jar is for FUN, you can spend cash from it in a restaurant or go play bowling, take a trip to Disneyland etc.
Press SAVE Button to save changes
Not added, not enough cash in jar
Do you really want to exit?
Press back one more time to exit
To delete a cashflow, press back and make a long press on cashflow in list
To delete a cashflow make a long press on item
Jar\'s percent explaining what sum goes to jar with new total income.

" Author of \"jars\" method offers to get 6 \"jars\" (it can be not only jar or jug, but even an envelope) and sign each of them in accordance to the purposes for what money will be spent out of the jar:"

This method is an evolution of envelope method. The classical method of envelopes used by our mothers and grandmothers, it\'s simple and effective. The idea is very simple - start up a special envelope for each major category of spending, signed by name and amount. If you run out of money in the \"Food\" envelope, you will have to take them out from other less important envelope. For the next month you should review the amount of envelope. You can put savings or spend the money left in an envelope at the end of the month.
The necessity spending (Necessity Account, NEC) - 55%. This jar contains money for most important expenses: food, utilities, clothing, rent, transport, medicine, etc.
Entertainment Account (Play Account, PLAY) - 10% .Money from this jar you can spend to go to a Japanese restaurant, bowling or movie. Fun, in over words…
Account for gifts and charity (Give Account, GIVE) - 5%. Money from this jar can be used for charity or gifts to friends, family, neighbors.
Educational expenses jar (Education Account, EDU) - 10%. You can spend money from this jar to education, directly to tutoring or college, or purchase a books, films, trainings etc.

Reserve fund and the account for big purchases (Long Term Saving for Spending Account, LTSS) - 10%. This account accumulates money that can be used both as a \"safety cushion\" (reserve fund) and as savings for big purchases (vacation, car, TV, dentistry, etc.).

Financial Freedom Account (Financial Freedom Account, FFA) - 10%. This jar is the key to your financial well-being. Money from this jar is not wasted in any condition. It\'s used for investment and passive income source.

This budgeting scheme is consistent with the method of envelopes: each month the entire gross income is distributing to jars: first for current necessities jar, then at the jar of financial freedom, and then to the rest of the account. Of course, you can get other percentages between jars, but it\'s close enough to the ideal structure of spending and investment, and you should strive for it.

WHY method of 6 jars are so effective?

Simplicity. No need to be a rocket scientist to distribute the money in 6 categories.
It will take one to two minutes for everything. And at the same time - you effectively manage your family budget. All you need is to distribute the money in several categories and stick to simple rules. Or rather one rule.
"Do not take money for expenses from a jar intended for other expenses."
You will learn to live within your incomes. At least you will try. Maybe you'll refuse loans and borrow money.
Don\'t pour the rest of previous incomes to any jar
Rest of all jars EXCEPT FFA goes to LTSS
Rest of all jars goes to FFA
Rest of jar goes to FFA
Rest of jar goes to LTSS
Not poured a rest of previous incomes
Rest of previous incomes poured in
Rest of all jars goes to LTSS (except FFA)
Pour the rest of previous incomes in savings jar?
Changes are not saved. Sum of percentage must be 100%
